TEXT.Italian: This civ is disabled. (Click to enable)
TEXT.Spanish: This civ is disabled. (Click to enable)

TEXT.English: Ignores checks for the AI unique historical victory goals. It increases speed if enabled.[NEWLINE](The AI is not aware of the historical victory goals and will not attempt to achieve these)
TEXT.French: Ignores checks for the AI unique historical victory goals. It increases speed if enabled.[NEWLINE](The AI is not aware of the historical victory goals and will not attempt to achieve these)
TEXT.German: Ignores checks for the AI unique historical victory goals. It increases speed if enabled.[NEWLINE](The AI is not aware of the historical victory goals and will not attempt to achieve these)
TEXT.Italian: Ignores checks for the AI unique historical victory goals. It increases speed if enabled.[NEWLINE](The AI is not aware of the historical victory goals and will not attempt to achieve these)
TEXT.Spanish: Ignores checks for the AI unique historical victory goals. It increases speed if enabled.[NEWLINE](The AI is not aware of the historical victory goals and will not attempt to achieve these)

TEXT.English: Allows the human player to switch multiple times.
TEXT.French: Allows the human player to switch multiple times.
TEXT.German: Allows the human player to switch multiple times.
TEXT.Italian: Allows the human player to switch multiple times.
TEXT.Spanish: Allows the human player to switch multiple times.

TEXT.English: Variable which stores if the player has already switched. (Red means the player CAN still switch)
TEXT.French: Variable which stores if the player has already switched. (Red means the player CAN still switch)
TEXT.German: Variable which stores if the player has already switched. (Red means the player CAN still switch)
TEXT.Italian: Variable which stores if the player has already switched. (Red means the player CAN still switch)
TEXT.Spanish: Variable which stores if the player has already switched. (Red means the player CAN still switch)

TEXT.English: Disables congresses. Both normal and war congresses.
TEXT.French: Disables congresses. Both normal and war congresses.
TEXT.German: Disables congresses. Both normal and war congresses.
TEXT.Italian: Disables congresses. Both normal and war congresses.
TEXT.Spanish: Disables congresses. Both normal and war congresses.

TEXT.English: Disables the start of a plague and all effects of the plague.[NEWLINE](Do NOT turn on while a plague is happening, otherwise it will not disappear)
TEXT.French: Disables the start of a plague and all effects of the plague.[NEWLINE](Do NOT turn on while a plague is happening, otherwise it will not disappear)
TEXT.German: Disables the start of a plague and all effects of the plague.[NEWLINE](Do NOT turn on while a plague is happening, otherwise it will not disappear)
TEXT.Italian: Disables the start of a plague and all effects of the plague.[NEWLINE](Do NOT turn on while a plague is happening, otherwise it will not disappear)
TEXT.Spanish: Disables the start of a plague and all effects of the plague.[NEWLINE](Do NOT turn on while a plague is happening, otherwise it will not disappear)

TEXT.English: Number of turns left before the next congress starts. Click to reduce the amount of turns by the given amount.[NEWLINE](-1 indicates that congresses are not possible)
TEXT.French: Number of turns left before the next congress starts. Click to reduce the amount of turns by the given amount.[NEWLINE](-1 indicates that congresses are not possible)
TEXT.German: Number of turns left before the next congress starts. Click to reduce the amount of turns by the given amount.[NEWLINE](-1 indicates that congresses are not possible)

TEXT.Spanish: Number of turns left before the next congress starts. Click to reduce the amount of turns by the given amount.[NEWLINE](-1 indicates that congresses are not possible)

TEXT.English: Restores StoredData to last created backup. If no manual backup is created, the last created backup is when the savefile was loaded. (StoredData changes of played turns since the last backup is made will be lost when the backup is restored)
TEXT.French: Restores StoredData to last created backup. If no manual backup is created, the last created backup is when the savefile was loaded. (StoredData changes of played turns since the last backup is made will be lost when the backup is restored)
TEXT.German: Restores StoredData to last created backup. If no manual backup is created, the last created backup is when the savefile was loaded. (StoredData changes of played turns since the last backup is made will be lost when the backup is restored)
TEXT.Italian: Restores StoredData to last created backup. If no manual backup is created, the last created backup is when the savefile was loaded. (StoredData changes of played turns since the last backup is made will be lost when the backup is restored)
TEXT.Spanish: Restores StoredData to last created backup. If no manual backup is created, the last created backup is when the savefile was loaded. (StoredData changes of played turns since the last backup is made will be lost when the backup is restored)

TEXT.English: Saves the current state of the StoredData.

TEXT.German: Saves the current state of the StoredData.
TEXT.Italian: Saves the current state of the StoredData.
TEXT.Spanish: Saves the current state of the StoredData.

TEXT.English: The flipzone tool is created to view and export the flipzone of a civ. All changes made in the WB will have NO ingame effect. The changes first need to be exported and applied to the Python files to have an effect.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Left clicking on tiles will add them to the flipzone. Right clicking will remove them from the flipzone. Tiles can be made AI only by left clicking on them when the "AI only" option is enabled.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend:[NEWLINE][COLOR_CYAN]Cyan[COLOR_REVERT]: Spawn plot[NEWLINE][COLOR_MAGENTA]Magenta[COLOR_REVERT]: Flipzone[NEWLINE][COLOR_RED]Red[COLOR_REVERT]: AI only flipzone[NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_DARK_DARK_GREEN]Dark green[COLOR_REVERT]: Special additional flip plots (currently only used for additional Canadian cities)[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Changes can be exported by clicking on the export button. One can export the flipzones of all civs by holding the alt-key when clicking the export button. The exported areas should be copy-pasted to Areas.py.
TEXT.French: The flipzone tool is created to view and export the flipzone of a civ. All changes made in the WB will have NO ingame effect. The changes first need to be exported and applied to the Python files to have an effect.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Left clicking on tiles will add them to the flipzone. Right clicking will remove them from the flipzone. Tiles can be made AI only by left clicking on them when the "AI only" option is enabled.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend:[NEWLINE][COLOR_CYAN]Cyan[COLOR_REVERT]: Spawn plot[NEWLINE][COLOR_MAGENTA]Magenta[COLOR_REVERT]: Flipzone[NEWLINE][COLOR_RED]Red[COLOR_REVERT]: AI only flipzone[NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_DARK_DARK_GREEN]Dark green[COLOR_REVERT]: Special additional flip plots (currently only used for additional Canadian cities)[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Changes can be exported by clicking on the export button. One can export the flipzones of all civs by holding the alt-key when clicking the export button. The exported areas should be copy-pasted to Areas.py.
TEXT.German: The flipzone tool is created to view and export the flipzone of a civ. All changes made in the WB will have NO ingame effect. The changes first need to be exported and applied to the Python files to have an effect.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Left clicking on tiles will add them to the flipzone. Right clicking will remove them from the flipzone. Tiles can be made AI only by left clicking on them when the "AI only" option is enabled.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend:[NEWLINE][COLOR_CYAN]Cyan[COLOR_REVERT]: Spawn plot[NEWLINE][COLOR_MAGENTA]Magenta[COLOR_REVERT]: Flipzone[NEWLINE][COLOR_RED]Red[COLOR_REVERT]: AI only flipzone[NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_DARK_DARK_GREEN]Dark green[COLOR_REVERT]: Special additional flip plots (currently only used for additional Canadian cities)[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Changes can be exported by clicking on the export button. One can export the flipzones of all civs by holding the alt-key when clicking the export button. The exported areas should be copy-pasted to Areas.py.
TEXT.Italian: The flipzone tool is created to view and export the flipzone of a civ. All changes made in the WB will have NO ingame effect. The changes first need to be exported and applied to the Python files to have an effect.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Left clicking on tiles will add them to the flipzone. Right clicking will remove them from the flipzone. Tiles can be made AI only by left clicking on them when the "AI only" option is enabled.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend:[NEWLINE][COLOR_CYAN]Cyan[COLOR_REVERT]: Spawn plot[NEWLINE][COLOR_MAGENTA]Magenta[COLOR_REVERT]: Flipzone[NEWLINE][COLOR_RED]Red[COLOR_REVERT]: AI only flipzone[NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_DARK_DARK_GREEN]Dark green[COLOR_REVERT]: Special additional flip plots (currently only used for additional Canadian cities)[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Changes can be exported by clicking on the export button. One can export the flipzones of all civs by holding the alt-key when clicking the export button. The exported areas should be copy-pasted to Areas.py.
TEXT.Spanish: The flipzone tool is created to view and export the flipzone of a civ. All changes made in the WB will have NO ingame effect. The changes first need to be exported and applied to the Python files to have an effect.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Left clicking on tiles will add them to the flipzone. Right clicking will remove them from the flipzone. Tiles can be made AI only by left clicking on them when the "AI only" option is enabled.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend:[NEWLINE][COLOR_CYAN]Cyan[COLOR_REVERT]: Spawn plot[NEWLINE][COLOR_MAGENTA]Magenta[COLOR_REVERT]: Flipzone[NEWLINE][COLOR_RED]Red[COLOR_REVERT]: AI only flipzone[NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_DARK_DARK_GREEN]Dark green[COLOR_REVERT]: Special additional flip plots (currently only used for additional Canadian cities)[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Changes can be exported by clicking on the export button. One can export the flipzones of all civs by holding the alt-key when clicking the export button. The exported areas should be copy-pasted to Areas.py.

TEXT.English: The core editor tool is created to view, edit and export the core of a civ.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Left clicking on non-core tiles will add them tiles to the core.[NEWLINE]Right clicking on core tiles will remove them from the core.[NEWLINE]The reset button will revert the core to the default core defined in Python. Holding the alt-key when clicking the reset button will revert the cores of all civs.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]All changes made to the core in the WB are applied immediately to that savegame. But a new game starts with the old core defined in Python. You have to export the new core and copy-paste it to the Python files to make the changes effect new games.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend:[NEWLINE][COLOR_CYAN]Cyan[COLOR_REVERT]: Core[NEWLINE][COLOR_GREEN]Green[COLOR_REVERT]: Historical (settlervalue >= 90)[NEWLINE][COLOR_YELLOW]Yellow[COLOR_REVERT]: Contested (historical and in foreign core)[NEWLINE][COLOR_RED]Red[COLOR_REVERT]: Foreign core[NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_LIGHT_PURPLE]Light Purple[COLOR_REVERT]: Forbidden for AI to settle (settlervalue = 3)[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Exporting:[NEWLINE]The core maps will be exported in the TL-BR format with a list of exceptions. (The latter only if applicable.) There is an autodection if the core has changed or not. One can force the game to export the core area by holding the shift-key when clicking on the export button. The cores of all civs can be exported at once by holding the alt-key when clicking the export button. The exported areas should be copy-pasted to Areas.py.
TEXT.French: The core editor tool is created to view, edit and export the core of a civ.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Left clicking on non-core tiles will add them tiles to the core.[NEWLINE]Right clicking on core tiles will remove them from the core.[NEWLINE]The reset button will revert the core to the default core defined in Python. Holding the alt-key when clicking the reset button will revert the cores of all civs.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]All changes made to the core in the WB are applied immediately to that savegame. But a new game starts with the old core defined in Python. You have to export the new core and copy-paste it to the Python files to make the changes effect new games.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend:[NEWLINE][COLOR_CYAN]Cyan[COLOR_REVERT]: Core[NEWLINE][COLOR_GREEN]Green[COLOR_REVERT]: Historical (settlervalue >= 90)[NEWLINE][COLOR_YELLOW]Yellow[COLOR_REVERT]: Contested (historical and in foreign core)[NEWLINE][COLOR_RED]Red[COLOR_REVERT]: Foreign core[NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_LIGHT_PURPLE]Light Purple[COLOR_REVERT]: Forbidden for AI to settle (settlervalue = 3)[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Exporting:[NEWLINE]The core maps will be exported in the TL-BR format with a list of exceptions. (The latter only if applicable.) There is an autodection if the core has changed or not. One can force the game to export the core area by holding the shift-key when clicking on the export button. The cores of all civs can be exported at once by holding the alt-key when clicking the export button. The exported areas should be copy-pasted to Areas.py.
TEXT.German: The core editor tool is created to view, edit and export the core of a civ.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Left clicking on non-core tiles will add them tiles to the core.[NEWLINE]Right clicking on core tiles will remove them from the core.[NEWLINE]The reset button will revert the core to the default core defined in Python. Holding the alt-key when clicking the reset button will revert the cores of all civs.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]All changes made to the core in the WB are applied immediately to that savegame. But a new game starts with the old core defined in Python. You have to export the new core and copy-paste it to the Python files to make the changes effect new games.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend:[NEWLINE][COLOR_CYAN]Cyan[COLOR_REVERT]: Core[NEWLINE][COLOR_GREEN]Green[COLOR_REVERT]: Historical (settlervalue >= 90)[NEWLINE][COLOR_YELLOW]Yellow[COLOR_REVERT]: Contested (historical and in foreign core)[NEWLINE][COLOR_RED]Red[COLOR_REVERT]: Foreign core[NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_LIGHT_PURPLE]Light Purple[COLOR_REVERT]: Forbidden for AI to settle (settlervalue = 3)[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Exporting:[NEWLINE]The core maps will be exported in the TL-BR format with a list of exceptions. (The latter only if applicable.) There is an autodection if the core has changed or not. One can force the game to export the core area by holding the shift-key when clicking on the export button. The cores of all civs can be exported at once by holding the alt-key when clicking the export button. The exported areas should be copy-pasted to Areas.py.
TEXT.Italian: The core editor tool is created to view, edit and export the core of a civ.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Left clicking on non-core tiles will add them tiles to the core.[NEWLINE]Right clicking on core tiles will remove them from the core.[NEWLINE]The reset button will revert the core to the default core defined in Python. Holding the alt-key when clicking the reset button will revert the cores of all civs.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]All changes made to the core in the WB are applied immediately to that savegame. But a new game starts with the old core defined in Python. You have to export the new core and copy-paste it to the Python files to make the changes effect new games.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend:[NEWLINE][COLOR_CYAN]Cyan[COLOR_REVERT]: Core[NEWLINE][COLOR_GREEN]Green[COLOR_REVERT]: Historical (settlervalue >= 90)[NEWLINE][COLOR_YELLOW]Yellow[COLOR_REVERT]: Contested (historical and in foreign core)[NEWLINE][COLOR_RED]Red[COLOR_REVERT]: Foreign core[NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_LIGHT_PURPLE]Light Purple[COLOR_REVERT]: Forbidden for AI to settle (settlervalue = 3)[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Exporting:[NEWLINE]The core maps will be exported in the TL-BR format with a list of exceptions. (The latter only if applicable.) There is an autodection if the core has changed or not. One can force the game to export the core area by holding the shift-key when clicking on the export button. The cores of all civs can be exported at once by holding the alt-key when clicking the export button. The exported areas should be copy-pasted to Areas.py.
TEXT.Spanish: The core editor tool is created to view, edit and export the core of a civ.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Left clicking on non-core tiles will add them tiles to the core.[NEWLINE]Right clicking on core tiles will remove them from the core.[NEWLINE]The reset button will revert the core to the default core defined in Python. Holding the alt-key when clicking the reset button will revert the cores of all civs.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]All changes made to the core in the WB are applied immediately to that savegame. But a new game starts with the old core defined in Python. You have to export the new core and copy-paste it to the Python files to make the changes effect new games.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend:[NEWLINE][COLOR_CYAN]Cyan[COLOR_REVERT]: Core[NEWLINE][COLOR_GREEN]Green[COLOR_REVERT]: Historical (settlervalue >= 90)[NEWLINE][COLOR_YELLOW]Yellow[COLOR_REVERT]: Contested (historical and in foreign core)[NEWLINE][COLOR_RED]Red[COLOR_REVERT]: Foreign core[NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_LIGHT_PURPLE]Light Purple[COLOR_REVERT]: Forbidden for AI to settle (settlervalue = 3)[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Exporting:[NEWLINE]The core maps will be exported in the TL-BR format with a list of exceptions. (The latter only if applicable.) There is an autodection if the core has changed or not. One can force the game to export the core area by holding the shift-key when clicking on the export button. The cores of all civs can be exported at once by holding the alt-key when clicking the export button. The exported areas should be copy-pasted to Areas.py.

TEXT.English: The settlermap editor tool is created to view, edit and export the settlervalues of a civ.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Left clicking on a tile will set the settlervalue of that tile to the preset value.[NEWLINE]Right clicking on a tile will set the settlervalue to the default value (20).[NEWLINE]The reset button will revert all settlervalues to the default values of the civ defined in Python. Holding the alt-key when clicking the reset button will revert the settlervalues of all civs.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The higher the settlervalue, the more likely the AI will settle on those tiles. All tiles with a settervalue 90 or higher are considered historical by the game. The AI is forbidden to settle on tiles with a settlervalue of 3.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]All changes made to the core in the WB are applied immediately to that savegame. But a new game starts with the old settlervalues defined in Python. You have to export the new settlervalues and copy-paste it to the Python files to make the changes effect new games.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend:[NEWLINE][COLOR_CYAN]Cyan[COLOR_REVERT]: Core[NEWLINE][COLOR_GREEN]Green[COLOR_REVERT]: Historical (settlervalue >= 90)[NEWLINE][COLOR_YELLOW]Yellow[COLOR_REVERT]: Contested (historical and in foreign core)[NEWLINE][COLOR_RED]Red[COLOR_REVERT]: Foreign core[NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_LIGHT_PURPLE]Light Purple[COLOR_REVERT]: Forbidden for AI to settle (settlervalue = 3)[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Exporting:[NEWLINE]The settlervalue maps will be exported value map format. There is an autodection if the settlervalues have changed or not. One can force the game to export the settlervalue map by holding the shift-key when clicking on the export button. The settlervalues of all civs can be exported at once by holding the alt-key when clicking the export button. The exported maps should be copy-pasted to Settlermaps.py.
TEXT.French: The settlermap editor tool is created to view, edit and export the settlervalues of a civ.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Left clicking on a tile will set the settlervalue of that tile to the preset value.[NEWLINE]Right clicking on a tile will set the settlervalue to the default value (20).[NEWLINE]The reset button will revert all settlervalues to the default values of the civ defined in Python. Holding the alt-key when clicking the reset button will revert the settlervalues of all civs.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The higher the settlervalue, the more likely the AI will settle on those tiles. All tiles with a settervalue 90 or higher are considered historical by the game. The AI is forbidden to settle on tiles with a settlervalue of 3.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]All changes made to the core in the WB are applied immediately to that savegame. But a new game starts with the old settlervalues defined in Python. You have to export the new settlervalues and copy-paste it to the Python files to make the changes effect new games.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend:[NEWLINE][COLOR_CYAN]Cyan[COLOR_REVERT]: Core[NEWLINE][COLOR_GREEN]Green[COLOR_REVERT]: Historical (settlervalue >= 90)[NEWLINE][COLOR_YELLOW]Yellow[COLOR_REVERT]: Contested (historical and in foreign core)[NEWLINE][COLOR_RED]Red[COLOR_REVERT]: Foreign core[NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_LIGHT_PURPLE]Light Purple[COLOR_REVERT]: Forbidden for AI to settle (settlervalue = 3)[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Exporting:[NEWLINE]The settlervalue maps will be exported value map format. There is an autodection if the settlervalues have changed or not. One can force the game to export the settlervalue map by holding the shift-key when clicking on the export button. The settlervalues of all civs can be exported at once by holding the alt-key when clicking the export button. The exported maps should be copy-pasted to Settlermaps.py.

Holding the alt-key when clicking the reset button will revert the settlervalues of all civs.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The higher the settlervalue, the more likely the AI will settle on those tiles. You have to export the new settlervalues and copy-paste it to the Python files to make the changes effect new games.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend:[NEWLINE][COLOR_CYAN]Cyan[COLOR_REVERT]: Core[NEWLINE][COLOR_GREEN]Green[COLOR_REVERT]: Historical (settlervalue >= 90)[NEWLINE][COLOR_YELLOW]Yellow[COLOR_REVERT]: Contested (historical and in foreign core)[NEWLINE][COLOR_RED]Red[COLOR_REVERT]: Foreign core[NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_LIGHT_PURPLE]Light Purple[COLOR_REVERT]: Forbidden for AI to settle (settlervalue = 3)[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Exporting:[NEWLINE]The settlervalue maps will be exported value map format. There is an autodection if the settlervalues have changed or not. One can force the game to export the settlervalue map by holding the shift-key when clicking on the export button. The settlervalues of all civs can be exported at once by holding the alt-key when clicking the export button. The exported maps should be copy-pasted to Settlermaps.py.
TEXT.Spanish: The settlermap editor tool is created to view, edit and export the settlervalues of a civ.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Left clicking on a tile will set the settlervalue of that tile to the preset value.[NEWLINE]Right clicking on a tile will set the settlervalue to the default value (20).[NEWLINE]The reset button will revert all settlervalues to the default values of the civ defined in Python. Holding the alt-key when clicking the reset button will revert the settlervalues of all civs.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The higher the settlervalue, the more likely the AI will settle on those tiles. All tiles with a settervalue 90 or higher are considered historical by the game. The AI is forbidden to settle on tiles with a settlervalue of 3.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]All changes made to the core in the WB are applied immediately to that savegame. But a new game starts with the old settlervalues defined in Python. You have to export the new settlervalues and copy-paste it to the Python files to make the changes effect new games.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend:[NEWLINE][COLOR_CYAN]Cyan[COLOR_REVERT]: Core[NEWLINE][COLOR_GREEN]Green[COLOR_REVERT]: Historical (settlervalue >= 90)[NEWLINE][COLOR_YELLOW]Yellow[COLOR_REVERT]: Contested (historical and in foreign core)[NEWLINE][COLOR_RED]Red[COLOR_REVERT]: Foreign core[NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_LIGHT_PURPLE]Light Purple[COLOR_REVERT]: Forbidden for AI to settle (settlervalue = 3)[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Exporting:[NEWLINE]The settlervalue maps will be exported value map format. There is an autodection if the settlervalues have changed or not. One can force the game to export the settlervalue map by holding the shift-key when clicking on the export button. The settlervalues of all civs can be exported at once by holding the alt-key when clicking the export button. The exported maps should be copy-pasted to Settlermaps.py.

TEXT.English: The warmap editor tool is created to view, edit and export the warmap of a civ.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Left clicking on a tile will set the warvalue of that tile to the preset value.[NEWLINE]Right clicking on a tile will set the settlervalue to the default value (0).[NEWLINE]The reset button will revert the warmap to the default map of the civ defined in Python. Holding the alt-key when clicking the reset button will revert the warmaps of all civs.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The higher the warvalue, the more likely the AI will try to conquer those tiles.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]All changes made to the core in the WB are applied immediately to that savegame. But a new game starts with the old warmaps defined in Python. You have to export the new warmaps and copy-paste it to the Python files to make the changes effect new games.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend:[NEWLINE][COLOR_RED]Red[COLOR_REVERT]: 2[NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_ORANGE]Orange[COLOR_REVERT]: 4[NEWLINE][COLOR_YELLOW]Yellow[COLOR_REVERT]: 6[NEWLINE][COLOR_GREEN]Green[COLOR_REVERT]: 8[NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_DARK_GREEN]Dark green[COLOR_REVERT]: 10[NEWLINE][COLOR_BLUE]Blue[COLOR_REVERT]: 12 or higher[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Exporting:[NEWLINE]The warmaps will be exported value map format. There is an autodection if the warvalues have changed or not. One can force the game to export the warmap by holding the shift-key when clicking on the export button. The warmaps of all civs can be exported at once by holding the alt-key when clicking the export button. The exported maps should be copy-pasted to Warmaps.py.

There is an autodection if the warvalues have changed or not. One can force the game to export the warmap by holding the shift-key when clicking on the export button. The warmaps of all civs can be exported at once by holding the alt-key when clicking the export button. The exported maps should be copy-pasted to Warmaps.py.

TEXT.English: The religionmap editor tool is created toview the religion maps of a religion.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Left clicking on a tile will set the spreadfactor of that tile to the preset value.[NEWLINE]Right clicking on a tile will set the spreadfactor to the default value (none).[NEWLINE]The reset button will revert the spreadfactor of the selected religion of all tiles to the default value defined in Python. Holding the alt-key when clicking the reset button will revert the spreadfactors of all religions.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]All changes made to the spreadfactors in the WB are applied immediately to that savegame. But a new game starts with the old spreadfactors defined in Python. You have to manually edit the spreadfactors to effect new games.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend:[NEWLINE][COLOR_CYAN]Cyan[COLOR_REVERT]: Core[NEWLINE][COLOR_GREEN]Green[COLOR_REVERT]: Historical[NEWLINE][COLOR_YELLOW]Yellow[COLOR_REVERT]: Periphery[NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_ORANGE]Orange[COLOR_REVERT]: Minority[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Exporting:[NEWLINE]The religionmaps cannot be exported, because the spreadfactors are linked to the regions instead of individual tiles. Manual changes should be made in RegionMap.py.
TEXT.French: The religionmap editor tool is created toview the religion maps of a religion.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Left clicking on a tile will set the spreadfactor of that tile to the preset value.[NEWLINE]Right clicking on a tile will set the spreadfactor to the default value (none).[NEWLINE]The reset button will revert the spreadfactor of the selected religion of all tiles to the default value defined in Python. Holding the alt-key when clicking the reset button will revert the spreadfactors of all religions.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]All changes made to the spreadfactors in the WB are applied immediately to that savegame. But a new game starts with the old spreadfactors defined in Python. You have to manually edit the spreadfactors to effect new games.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend:[NEWLINE][COLOR_CYAN]Cyan[COLOR_REVERT]: Core[NEWLINE][COLOR_GREEN]Green[COLOR_REVERT]: Historical[NEWLINE][COLOR_YELLOW]Yellow[COLOR_REVERT]: Periphery[NEWLINE][COLOR_PLAYER_ORANGE]Orange[COLOR_REVERT]: Minority[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Exporting:[NEWLINE]The religionmaps cannot be exported, because the spreadfactors are linked to the regions instead of individual tiles. TEXT.English: The regionmap editor tool is created to edit and export the religion maps of a civ.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Left clicking on a tile will set the region ID of that tile to the preset region.[NEWLINE]Right clicking on a tile will set the region ID to "no region" (-1).[NEWLINE]The reset button will revert the region ID of all tiles to the default region IDs in Python.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]All changes made to the regions in the WB are applied immediately to that savegame. But a new game starts with the old regions defined in Python. You have to export the new regions and copy-paste it to the Python files to make the changes effect new games.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend:[NEWLINE][COLOR_BLUE]Blue[COLOR_REVERT]: Current region[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Exporting:[NEWLINE]The warmaps will be exported value map format. There is an autodection if the regionmap has changed or not. One can force the game to export the regionmap by holding the shift-key when clicking on the export button. The export function automatically sets the region ID of water tiles to "no region". The exported map should be copy-pasted to RegionMap.py.

But a new game starts with the old regions defined in Python. TEXT.English: The victorymap tool is created to view the maps used in Victory.py. It uses the getUHVTileInfo() function from CvScreensInterface.py to determine which tiles do count towards the UHV. It can only show the maps and it mainly meant for easy checking of the victory areas.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The areas highlighted are only land tiles. It also highlights the peak tiles, although some UHV do not include those. The full TL-BR area can be viewed when the option "show full rectangle" is enabled.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend:[NEWLINE][COLOR_MAGENTA]Magenta[COLOR_REVERT]: UHV land area[NEWLINE][COLOR_LIGHT_GREY]Light grey[COLOR_REVERT]: Water tiles in the full TL-BR square
TEXT.French: The victorymap tool is created to view the maps used in Victory.py. It uses the getUHVTileInfo() function from CvScreensInterface.py to determine which tiles do count towards the UHV. It can only show the maps and it mainly meant for easy checking of the victory areas.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The areas highlighted are only land tiles. It also highlights the peak tiles, although some UHV do not include those. The full TL-BR area can be viewed when the option "show full rectangle" is enabled.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend:[NEWLINE][COLOR_MAGENTA]Magenta[COLOR_REVERT]: UHV land area[NEWLINE][COLOR_LIGHT_GREY]Light grey[COLOR_REVERT]: Water tiles in the full TL-BR square

TEXT.English: The movemap tool is created to easily move large portions of the map. Select size of the selection and what should be done with this after you moved this with the options in the dropdown menus. By clicking on the map, you will select the highlighted green area. This area will get a red highlight to indicate that you selected this area. Clicking again on the map, the red area will be pasted to the highlighted green cursor area.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you copy parts of the map (especially sea tiles), the tile texture can be a bit off. You can fix this by exiting the worldbuilder, saving the game and loading it again. This will rerender the all tiles and everything should be fine.
TEXT.French: The movemap tool is created to easily move large portions of the map. Select size of the selection and what should be done with this after you moved this with the options in the dropdown menus. By clicking on the map, you will select the highlighted green area. This area will get a red highlight to indicate that you selected this area. Clicking again on the map, the red area will be pasted to the highlighted green cursor area.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you copy parts of the map (especially sea tiles), the tile texture can be a bit off. You can fix this by exiting the worldbuilder, saving the game and loading it again. This will rerender the all tiles and everything should be fine.

You can fix this by exiting the worldbuilder, saving the game and loading it again. This will rerender the all tiles and everything should be fine.

TEXT.English: The export area tool is designed to easily create the TL-BR coordinates with the list of exception tiles.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Paint mode: Left click on tiles to add them to the selection. Right click to remove them from selection. The large brush and region selection is only enabled in this mode.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]TL-BR mode: First left click to select on of the corners of the square. Second left click to add the highlighted tiles to the selection. Second right click to remove the highlighted tiles from the selection.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Most scripts ignore peak and water tiles that are in the rectangle, so the do not have to be added to lExceptions. If you do want to add these tiles to lExceptions, you can enable that by clicking on the water or peak button.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend:[NEWLINE][COLOR_MAGENTA]Magenta tiles[COLOR_REVERT]: Selection[NEWLINE][COLOR_LIGHT_GREY]Light grey tiles[COLOR_REVERT]: Selected water or peak tiles when the "Add to lExceptions" option is enabled.
TEXT.French: The export area tool is designed to easily create the TL-BR coordinates with the list of exception tiles.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Paint mode: Left click on tiles to add them to the selection. Right click to remove them from selection. The large brush and region selection is only enabled in this mode.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]TL-BR mode: First left click to select on of the corners of the square. Second left click to add the highlighted tiles to the selection. Second right click to remove the highlighted tiles from the selection.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Most scripts ignore peak and water tiles that are in the rectangle, so the do not have to be added to lExceptions. If you do want to add these tiles to lExceptions, you can enable that by clicking on the water or peak button.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend:[NEWLINE][COLOR_MAGENTA]Magenta tiles[COLOR_REVERT]: Selection[NEWLINE][COLOR_LIGHT_GREY]Light grey tiles[COLOR_REVERT]: Selected water or peak tiles when the "Add to lExceptions" option is enabled.
TEXT.German: The export area tool is designed to easily create the TL-BR coordinates with the list of exception tiles.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Paint mode: Left click on tiles to add them to the selection. Second left click to add the highlighted tiles to the selection. Second right click to remove the highlighted tiles from the selection.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Most scripts ignore peak and water tiles that are in the rectangle, so the do not have to be added to lExceptions. If you do want to add these tiles to lExceptions, you can enable that by clicking on the water or peak button.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend:[NEWLINE][COLOR_MAGENTA]Magenta tiles[COLOR_REVERT]: Selection[NEWLINE][COLOR_LIGHT_GREY]Light grey tiles[COLOR_REVERT]: Selected water or peak tiles when the "Add to lExceptions" option is enabled.
TEXT.Spanish: The export area tool is designed to easily create the TL-BR coordinates with the list of exception tiles.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Paint mode: Left click on tiles to add them to the selection. Right click to remove them from selection. The large brush and region selection is only enabled in this mode.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]TL-BR mode: First left click to select on of the corners of the square. Second left click to add the highlighted tiles to the selection. Second right click to remove the highlighted tiles from the selection.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Most scripts ignore peak and water tiles that are in the rectangle, so the do not have to be added to lExceptions. If you do want to add these tiles to lExceptions, you can enable that by clicking on the water or peak button.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend:[NEWLINE][COLOR_MAGENTA]Magenta tiles[COLOR_REVERT]: Selection[NEWLINE][COLOR_LIGHT_GREY]Light grey tiles[COLOR_REVERT]: Selected water or peak tiles when the "Add to lExceptions" option is enabled.

TEXT.English: Check if all land tiles have a defined region
TEXT.French: Check if all land tiles have a defined region
TEXT.German: Check if all land tiles have a defined region
TEXT.Italian: Check if all land tiles have a defined region
TEXT.Spanish: Check if all land tiles have a defined region
